meanings.definition: Having a hooked or curved shape.
meanings.sent1: The uncate claw of the eagle helped it catch fish easily.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd's staff had an uncate end for guiding the sheep.
meanings.sent3: The uncate handle of the mug made it look like a quirky piece of art.
meanings.sent4: The uncate branches of the tree reached out like fingers searching for sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The uncate design of the key made it stand out among the others.

meanings.definition: To make something curved or hooked.
meanings.sent1: She tried to uncate the wire to hang the picture frame.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith used his tools to uncate the metal into a unique shape.
meanings.sent3: He uncateth the fishing hook to catch the big fish.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor uncateth the marble into a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent5: The magician uncateth the wand to perform his tricks.
